chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Abbie Renee Decorah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other conditions per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM Defendant Abbie Renee Decorah in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Abbie Renee Decorah.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states matter is resolved.  State states agreement.  Atty Getsinger agrees and enters NC pleas to counts 2 and 3.  DE agrees and also pleads NC.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement.  Atty Getsinger makes statement.  State responds as Atty Getsinger has requested expungement but that was not part of the offer.  Parties discuss.  Court questions parties re: victim info.  Parties respond, noting restitution would be joint and several.  Court addresses disagreement re: expungement and suggests a reset.  State wouldn't object noting this is attorney Albrecht's offer and he doesn't think he would have offered expungement in this case.  Atty Getsinger would withdraw their request for expungement and would be willing to proceed today.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.
 
Ct 1:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 2:  NC
Probation 24 months
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and any follow up counseling/treatment per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times 
No possession of any alcohol
No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business whose primary purpose is the sale/consumption of alcohol
Restitution per stip to Clerk of Courts Office - JOINT & SEVERAL
Any other conditions per agent
Ct 3:  NC
30 days jail w/huber and EMP - consecutive to any others
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
One (1) day credit to be applied
To commence on or before 11/25/2022 at 6:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:34 AM Defendant Abbie Renee Decorah in court.  Attorney Michael X. Albrecht in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Abbie Renee Decorah.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states the DE will waive her right to prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.
Atty Getsinger acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG plea(s).  TSC to be set in about 60 days.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
